Line 132: Line 132:
===Western Europe===
===Western Europe===
====Planning====
====Planning====
â
[[Image:Ju 87D-1.jpg|thumb|right|250px|The Junkers Ju 87 ''Stuka''. Richthofen grew to respect the ''Stuka'', and used them effectively when he commanded their ''Geschwader''.]]
 
The invasion of Poland prompted the [[United Kingdom]] and [[France]] to declare war on Germany. Through the winter, 1939-40, the ''Wehrmacht'' began preparations to invade the [[Netherlands]], [[Luxembourg]], [[Belgium]], and France. The basic plan called for an invasion of the Netherlands, by [[Army Group B]], and Belgium by Army Group B and [[Army Group A]]. The operation, [[Case Yellow]], was designed to suck in the Allied armies into the [[Low Countries]], and then breakout through the [[Ardennes]] in southern Belgium and Luxembourg, and advance to the [[English Channel]] to encircle and destroy them.
The invasion of Poland prompted the [[United Kingdom]] and [[France]] to declare war on Germany. Through the winter, 1939-40, the ''Wehrmacht'' began preparations to invade the [[Netherlands]], [[Luxembourg]], [[Belgium]], and France. The basic plan called for an invasion of the Netherlands, by [[Army Group B]], and Belgium by Army Group B and [[Army Group A]]. The operation, [[Case Yellow]], was designed to suck in the Allied armies into the [[Low Countries]], and then breakout through the [[Ardennes]] in southern Belgium and Luxembourg, and advance to the [[English Channel]] to encircle and destroy them.
